parse.title: List of first minority male lawyers and judges in Florida

text.*:
This is a list of the first minority male lawyer(s) and judge(s) in Florida. It includes the year in which the men were admitted to practice law (in parentheses). Also included are other distinctions such as the first minority men in their state to obtain a law degree or become a political figure.

Contents

  • 1 Firsts in state history
  • 2 Firsts in local history
  • 3 See also
  • 4 References

Firsts in state history[edit]

  • Harvey S. Harmon (1869):[1][2] First African American male lawyer in Florida
  • James Weldon Johnson (1897):[3] First African American male admitted to the Florida Bar after Reconstruction Era
  • Leander J. Shaw Jr. (1952):[4] First African American male appointed as a Justice of the Florida Supreme Court (1983)
  • Jose Alejandro Gonzalez Jr. (1957):[5] First Hispanic American male appointed as a Judge of the Seventeenth Judicial Circuit and the U. S. District Court, Southern District of Florida (1978). He was also the first Hispanic American Judge of the Broward Circuit Court (1964).
  • Joseph W. Hatchett (1959):[6][7][8] First African American male appointed as a Justice of the Florida Supreme Court (1975) and serve as its Chief Justice (1990)
  • Wilkie D. Ferguson (c. 1960s):[9] First African American male appointed as a Judge of the Eleventh Judicial Circuit Court of Florida (Dade County Circuit Court; 1977) and Florida Third District Court of Appeal (1980)
  • Henry Lee Adams Jr. (1969):[10] First African American male appointed as a Judge of the Fourth Judicial Circuit in Florida (1979)
  • Brian J. Davis (1980):[11] First African American male to serve as the Chief Assistant State Attorney in the Fourth Judicial Circuit (1994). He would later become a district court judge.
  • Raoul G. Cantero III (1985):[12] First Hispanic American male appointed as a Justice of the Florida Supreme Court (2002)
  • Sonny Im (1991):[13][14] First Korean American male judge in Florida (2002)
  • Darrin P. Gayles (1993):[15] First openly LGBT African American male appointed as a Judge of the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of Florida (2014)
  • Fred Seraphin:[16][14] First Haitian American male judge in Florida (2001)

Firsts in local history[edit]

Alphabetized by county name

  • Stephan P. Mickle (1970):[17] First African American male judge in Alachua County, Florida. He would later become a district court judge.
  • Anuraag Singal (1989):[18] First South Asian American male judge in Broward County, Florida (2011)
  • Abraham Bellamy (1822):[19] First male lawyer to settle in Jacksonville, Florida Duval County, Florida
  • Joseph E. Lee (1873):[20] First African American male lawyer in Jacksonville, Florida Duval County, Florida
  • Francis M. Robles (c. 1890):[21][22] First Hispanic American male lawyer in Hillsborough County, Florida. He would later become a judge.
  • M. Henry Cohen (1894) and Samuel Borchardt (1895):[22] First Jewish American male lawyers in Hillsborough County, Florida
  • Peter W. Bryant (c. 1898):[22] First African American male lawyer in Hillsborough County, Florida
  • Ted Taylor:[23] First African American male lawyer in Plant City, Florida Hillsborough County, Florida
  • Armstrong Purdee:[24] First African American male lawyer in Jackson County, Florida
  • Calvin Mapp:[25] First African American male judge in Miami-Dade County, Florida
  • James C. Collier (c. 1950):[26] First African American male lawyer in Orlando, Florida [Orange County, Florida]
  • Mel Martinez (c. 1970s):[27] First Hispanic American male lawyer in Orlando, Florida Orange County, Florida
  • James B. Sanderlin (1963):[28] First African American male judge in Pinellas County, Florida
  • Bill Holland Sr.:[29][30] First African American male lawyer in West Palm Beach, Florida Palm Beach County, Florida

See also[edit]

  • List of first minority male lawyers and judges in the United States
